articles.headline: Allies Start to Escalate Dispute Between Cruise and Viacom
articles.snippet: The war of words between Tom Cruise’s camp and Viacom chairman Sumner M. Redstone and his allies was on the verge of escalating from recrimination to retribution.
articles.abstract: The war of words between Tom Cruise’s camp and Viacom chairman Sumner M. Redstone and his allies was on the verge of escalating from recrimination to retribution.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article was reported by David M. Halbfinger, Geraldine Fabrikant and Sharon Waxman and written by Mr. Halbfinger.

articles.headline: Africa Adds to Miserable Ranks of Child Workers
articles.snippet: In sub-Saharan Africa, more than one in four children below age 14 works, and some are not even paid.
articles.abstract: In sub-Saharan Africa, more than one in four children below age 14 works, and some are not even paid.
articles.lead_paragraph: LUSAKA, Zambia — The boulders here are hard enough that the scavengers who have taken over the abandoned quarry south of downtown prefer not to strike them directly with their hammers.

articles.headline: Gaza Captors of 2 Newsmen Pressure U.S.
articles.snippet: A previously unknown Islamic group demanded the release of Muslims detained in U.S. prisons.
articles.abstract: A previously unknown Islamic group demanded the release of Muslims detained in U.S. prisons.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM, Aug. 23 — An unknown Islamic group on Wednesday issued a sweeping demand for the release of all Muslim prisoners held in the United States in exchange for two Fox News television journalists seized at gunpoint last week in Gaza.

articles.headline: New Signs of Cooling in Housing
articles.snippet: Home sales fell to the lowest level in more than two years as economists said the housing market was following the traditional path of a slowdown.
articles.abstract: Home sales fell to the lowest level in more than two years as economists said the housing market was following the traditional path of a slowdown.
articles.lead_paragraph: The housing market is deteriorating by the month.

articles.headline: Storm's Escape Routes: One Forced, One Chosen
articles.snippet: The experience for many New Orleanians who went west instead of east has been very different.
articles.abstract: The experience for many New Orleanians who went west instead of east has been very different.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA, Aug. 23 — The small van, painted a heraldic bright green, is planted like a flag amid the frenetic commerce of Midtown, claiming a speck of territory for Louisiana. Customers line up at the window to order New Orleans-style snowballs: fluffy concoctions of ice, flavor and condensed milk so delicate they immediately begin to puddle in the heat.

articles.headline: Ford Looks at Possibility of Alliances
articles.snippet: The Ford Motor Company is evaluating alliances with other automakers even as it moves ahead with its own revamping efforts.
articles.abstract: The Ford Motor Company is evaluating alliances with other automakers even as it moves ahead with its own revamping efforts.
articles.lead_paragraph: DEARBORN, Mich., Aug. 23 —The Ford Motor Company is evaluating the prospects for alliances with other automakers even as it moves ahead with its own revamping efforts, people who have been briefed on Ford’s activities said Wednesday.

articles.headline: Car Insurance Rates Drop in New Jersey
articles.snippet: For the first time in decades, car insurance rates are falling in New Jersey and insurance companies are fighting for drivers’ business.
articles.abstract: For the first time in decades, car insurance rates are falling in New Jersey and insurance companies are fighting for drivers’ business.
articles.lead_paragraph: Joseph Alfano, who works for an office supply company in Clifton, N.J., got a pleasant surprise when he renewed his car insurance this summer. The premium on his 1997 Mercury Mountaineer dropped nearly 30 percent, to $1,273 a year.

articles.headline: Merck Sees Successor to Vioxx
articles.snippet: Merck said its drug Arcoxia was shown in a study to be no more dangerous to the heart than an older painkiller still widely in use.
articles.abstract: Merck said its drug Arcoxia was shown in a study to be no more dangerous to the heart than an older painkiller still widely in use.
articles.lead_paragraph: Setting the stage for a scientific and regulatory battle, Merck said yesterday that a potential successor to its painkiller Vioxx had shown in a large study to be no more dangerous to the heart than an older painkiller still widely in use.

articles.headline: Some in G.O.P. Say Iran Threat Is Played Down
articles.snippet: Some senior Bush administration officials and top Republican lawmakers are voicing anger that American spy agencies have not issued more ominous warnings about the threats that they say Iran presents to the United States.      Some policy makers h...
articles.abstract: Some senior Bush administration officials and top Republican lawmakers are voicing anger that American spy agencies have not issued more ominous warnings about the threats that they say Iran presents to the United States.      Some policy makers have accused intelligence agencies of playing down Iran's role in Hezbollah's recent attacks against Israel and overestimating the time it would take for Iran to build a nuclear weapon.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23 - Some senior Bush administration officials and top Republican lawmakers are voicing anger that American spy agencies have not issued more ominous warnings about the threats that they say Iran presents to the United States.

articles.headline: Allies Start to Escalate Dispute Between Cruise and Viacom
articles.snippet: A day after Viacom's chairman, Sumner M. Redstone, abruptly evicted Tom Cruise from his longstanding home on the Paramount movie lot, the war of words between the actor's camp and Mr. Redstone and his allies was on the verge of escalating Wednesda...
articles.abstract: A day after Viacom's chairman, Sumner M. Redstone, abruptly evicted Tom Cruise from his longstanding home on the Paramount movie lot, the war of words between the actor's camp and Mr. Redstone and his allies was on the verge of escalating Wednesday from recrimination to retribution.     Mr. Cruise's representatives at Creative Artists Agency -- the leading talent shop in Hollywood, with a roster of actors, directors and writers so vast that it is nearly impossible for a studio to function without its cooperation -- signaled that they would be loath to do more business with Paramount if Mr. Redstone continued to call the shots from on high.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 23 - A day after Viacom's chairman, Sumner M. Redstone, abruptly evicted Tom Cruise from his longstanding home on the Paramount movie lot, the war of words between the actor's camp and Mr. Redstone and his allies was on the verge of escalating Wednesday from recrimination to retribution.
articles.byline: This article was reported by David M. Halbfinger, Geraldine Fabrikant and Sharon Waxman and Written By Mr. Halbfinger

articles.headline: Stem Cell News Could Intensify Political Debate
articles.snippet: Biologists have developed a technique for establishing colonies of human embryonic stem cells from an early human embryo without destroying it. This method, if confirmed in other laboratories, would seem to remove the principal objection to the re...
articles.abstract: Biologists have developed a technique for establishing colonies of human embryonic stem cells from an early human embryo without destroying it. This method, if confirmed in other laboratories, would seem to remove the principal objection to the research.     It could also redirect and intensify the emotional political debate over current limits on federal financing for research on human embryonic stem cells, which give rise to the cells and tissues of the body and which scientists and patient advocate groups see as a potential source for treatments for diseases like Alzheimer's, Parkinson's and diabetes.
articles.lead_paragraph: Biologists have developed a technique for establishing colonies of human embryonic stem cells from an early human embryo without destroying it. This method, if confirmed in other laboratories, would seem to remove the principal objection to the research.

articles.headline: New Signs of Cooling in Housing
articles.snippet: The housing market is deteriorating by the month.     In the latest and strongest indication that the home buying and selling frenzy is over, the National Association of Realtors reported yesterday that sales of previously owned homes fell to the ...
articles.abstract: The housing market is deteriorating by the month.     In the latest and strongest indication that the home buying and selling frenzy is over, the National Association of Realtors reported yesterday that sales of previously owned homes fell to the lowest level in July in more than two years, prices flattened and sellers waited longer and longer to find buyers for their homes. The supply of unsold houses on the market hit a record high.
articles.lead_paragraph: The housing market is deteriorating by the month.

articles.headline: Gaza Captors of 2 Newsmen Pressure U.S.
articles.snippet: An unknown Islamic group on Wednesday issued a sweeping demand for the release of all Muslim prisoners held in the United States in exchange for two Fox News television journalists seized at gunpoint last week in Gaza.     The group, calling itsel...
articles.abstract: An unknown Islamic group on Wednesday issued a sweeping demand for the release of all Muslim prisoners held in the United States in exchange for two Fox News television journalists seized at gunpoint last week in Gaza.     The group, calling itself the Holy Jihad Brigades, had not claimed responsibility for the abductions or made any demands until Wednesday, when it released a statement along with a video of the two men, Steve Centanni, 60, an American based in Washington, and Olaf Wiig, 36, a cameraman from New Zealand.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM, Aug. 23 - An unknown Islamic group on Wednesday issued a sweeping demand for the release of all Muslim prisoners held in the United States in exchange for two Fox News television journalists seized at gunpoint last week in Gaza.

articles.headline: Storm's Escape Routes: One Forced, One Chosen
articles.snippet: The small van, painted a heraldic bright green, is planted like a flag amid the frenetic commerce of Midtown, claiming a speck of territory for Louisiana. Customers line up at the window to order New Orleans-style snowballs: fluffy concoctions of ...
articles.abstract: The small van, painted a heraldic bright green, is planted like a flag amid the frenetic commerce of Midtown, claiming a speck of territory for Louisiana. Customers line up at the window to order New Orleans-style snowballs: fluffy concoctions of ice, flavor and condensed milk so delicate they immediately begin to puddle in the heat.     To Kenneth Woodfin, an entrepreneurial 26-year-old who fled New Orleans a year ago as Hurricane Katrina approached, the van is not only his first business venture, but also an emblem of his family's new, more prosperous life in Atlanta. His younger sister works the window. His older sister, a bank teller, makes substantially more than she did back home, and her husband has landed his first white-collar job, at a car rental company. The couple is looking for a house to buy.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA, Aug. 23 - The small van, painted a heraldic bright green, is planted like a flag amid the frenetic commerce of Midtown, claiming a speck of territory for Louisiana. Customers line up at the window to order New Orleans-style snowballs: fluffy concoctions of ice, flavor and condensed milk so delicate they immediately begin to puddle in the heat.

articles.headline: Car Insurance Rates Drop in New Jersey
articles.snippet: Joseph Alfano, who works for an office supply company in Clifton, N.J., got a pleasant surprise when he renewed his car insurance this summer. The premium on his 1997 Mercury Mountaineer dropped nearly 30 percent, to $1,273 a year.     ''It went d...
articles.abstract: Joseph Alfano, who works for an office supply company in Clifton, N.J., got a pleasant surprise when he renewed his car insurance this summer. The premium on his 1997 Mercury Mountaineer dropped nearly 30 percent, to $1,273 a year.     ''It went down almost $500,'' Mr. Alfano said. ''That's significant money.''
articles.lead_paragraph: Joseph Alfano, who works for an office supply company in Clifton, N.J., got a pleasant surprise when he renewed his car insurance this summer. The premium on his 1997 Mercury Mountaineer dropped nearly 30 percent, to $1,273 a year.

articles.headline: Africa Adds to Miserable Ranks of Child Workers
articles.snippet: The boulders here are hard enough that the scavengers who have taken over the abandoned quarry south of downtown prefer not to strike them directly with their hammers.      They heat the rocks first -- with flaming tires, scrap plastic, even old r...
articles.abstract: The boulders here are hard enough that the scavengers who have taken over the abandoned quarry south of downtown prefer not to strike them directly with their hammers.      They heat the rocks first -- with flaming tires, scrap plastic, even old rubber boots -- so that the stones will fracture more easily.
articles.lead_paragraph: LUSAKA, Zambia - The boulders here are hard enough that the scavengers who have taken over the abandoned quarry south of downtown prefer not to strike them directly with their hammers.

articles.headline: Merck Sees Successor to Vioxx
articles.snippet: Setting the stage for a scientific and regulatory battle, Merck said yesterday that a potential successor to its painkiller Vioxx had shown in a large study to be no more dangerous to the heart than an older painkiller still widely in use.      Th...
articles.abstract: Setting the stage for a scientific and regulatory battle, Merck said yesterday that a potential successor to its painkiller Vioxx had shown in a large study to be no more dangerous to the heart than an older painkiller still widely in use.      The Merck drug, Arcoxia, is already sold in 62 countries, but so far regulators in the United States have deferred approving the drug. Until yesterday analysts had said that Arcoxia had little chance of being approved because of concerns that it might have heart risks similar to Vioxx, which Merck withdrew from the market in 2004 over safety concerns.
articles.lead_paragraph: Setting the stage for a scientific and regulatory battle, Merck said yesterday that a potential successor to its painkiller Vioxx had shown in a large study to be no more dangerous to the heart than an older painkiller still widely in use.

articles.headline: Ford Looks at Possibility of Alliances
articles.snippet: The Ford Motor Company is evaluating the prospects for alliances with other automakers even as it moves ahead with its own revamping efforts, people who have been briefed on Ford's activities said Wednesday.     The evaluation of possible alliance...
articles.abstract: The Ford Motor Company is evaluating the prospects for alliances with other automakers even as it moves ahead with its own revamping efforts, people who have been briefed on Ford's activities said Wednesday.     The evaluation of possible alliances is being led by William Clay Ford Jr., who serves as chief executive and chairman of Ford, the second-biggest and the oldest American car company, these people said. They spoke anonymously because of the sensitivity of the talks.
articles.lead_paragraph: DEARBORN, Mich., Aug. 23 - The Ford Motor Company is evaluating the prospects for alliances with other automakers even as it moves ahead with its own revamping efforts, people who have been briefed on Ford's activities said Wednesday.
